title: Investigate OpenCode auto-executing tool/ scripts
description:
RESOLVED: tool/ folder was being auto-executed by OpenCode incorrectly.

Root cause: Having a folder named 'tool/' at project root confused OpenCode. OpenCode expects .opencode/tool/ to contain TypeScript/JavaScript tool definitions using the tool() helper - NOT plain scripts.

Fix applied:
- Renamed tool/ → scripts/
- Updated references in agent/reviewer.md, AGENTS.md, README.md, bin/*.sh

Our 'hard tools' are plain Node.js scripts meant to be called via bash, NOT native OpenCode tool definitions. They belong in scripts/ (or any neutral folder name).

Future consideration: Could convert these to proper OpenCode tools using the tool() helper from @opencode-ai/plugin for better integration.

title: Convert hard tools to native OpenCode tools
description:
Consider converting our bash scripts in scripts/ to proper OpenCode tool definitions for tighter integration.

Current state:
- 4 scripts in scripts/: validate-runtime.js, analyze-bindings.js, validate-ui.js, codify-feedback.js
- Called via bash by agents/commands
- Plain Node.js scripts that output JSON

Target state:
- Convert to TypeScript using tool() helper from @opencode-ai/plugin
- Place in .opencode/tool/
- LLM can call them directly without bash wrapper

Reference: Joel Hooks has tools/ at root - check his implementation for patterns.

Benefits:
- Direct LLM invocation (no bash wrapper)
- Type-safe args with Zod validation
- Access to OpenCode context (agent, sessionID, etc.)
- Better error handling
notes: Converted all hard tools to native OpenCode tools. Created tool/cloudflare-bindings.ts (analyze_bindings, list_bindings, validate_bindings), tool/ui-validator.ts (validate_ui, check_ui, list_shadcn_components), and extended tool/ubs.ts with validate_kv, check_kv, validate_secrets, check_secrets. Workers runtime and D1 validation were already integrated.
